header_summary:
Ava Chow announced the release of Bitcoin Core's latest version v28.0rc1, accessible for download and source code review, highlighting its role in the software's development cycle and emphasizing the community's contribution to refining this major version through feedback on release candidates [Bitcoin Core v28.0rc1](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.0/test.rc1/). Weiji Guo introduced a novel solution for enhancing open application circuits via recursive verification, a method that streamlines the verification process without the need for publishing each circuit's verification key on-chain, detailed on the dedicated [OP_ZKP GitHub](https://github.com/opzkp).

Antoine Riard advocated for the creation of "free-to-pwn" lightning nodes on the mainnet to facilitate controlled, sophisticated cross-layer attacks, aiming to expose and evaluate potential vulnerabilities within the Bitcoin ecosystem in a real-world setting, thereby fostering a transparent discussion about the protocol's security [Linux Foundation's mailing list](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2021-May/018925.html). Meanwhile, Fi3 is developing an SV2 extension to improve mining pool payout transparency and fairness, allowing miners to select transactions for varying fee structures, with the project actively seeking community input to refine the system [SV2 extension development](https://github.com/demand-open-source/share-accounting-ext/blob/281c1cbc4f9a07b21a443753a525197dc5d8e18c/extension.md).

Valuedmammal's tests on the full-rbf node versus bip125 node underscored the importance of node behavior in maintaining network health, suggesting that monitoring and adapting node policies could optimize the p2p network's efficiency [Node behavior study](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/casual-research-on-running-mempoolfullrbf/1077/5). Moonsettler discussed the implementation challenges of escrow services within the Lightning Network, proposing alternative solutions like predicated e-cash escrows to ensure transaction security and privacy, indicating ongoing efforts to overcome technical hurdles for efficient escrow transactions [Escrow services in LN](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/dnm-ecash-and-privacy/916/12).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 28.0 Release Candidate 1 Available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core v28.0rc1 is now available for download and testing.
- Preliminary release notes detailing improvements are accessible online.
- Feedback on this version will help finalize it as the official v28.0 release.

recent_posts.title: OP_ZKP updates
recent_posts.summary:
- A new solution for open application circuits involves recursive verification.
- A GitHub organization and "tea-horse" repository were created to share developments.
- Interested parties are encouraged to contribute to the evolving project.

recent_posts.title: Demonstrating Pinning Attacks under Real-World Conditions
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine proposes establishing "free-to-pwn" lightning nodes for real-world attack tests.
- He criticizes the over-simplification of node and lightning complexities by some experts.
- Public demonstrations aim to enhance understanding and transparency in Bitcoin security.

recent_posts.title: PPLNS with job declaration
recent_posts.summary:
- Development of an SV2 extension for fairer mining pool payouts is in progress.
- This extension grants miners the ability to choose transactions and fee structures.
- The project seeks reviews to refine the system, with details available on GitHub.

recent_posts.title: Casual research on running `mempoolfullrbf`
recent_posts.summary:
- The full-rbf node showed less score variance, indicating stable network behavior.
- Uptime variance and peer connections were managed to enhance network visibility and robustness.
- The discussion aims at balancing node policy with network evolution for optimal mempool efficiency.

recent_posts.title: DNM, eCash and privacy
recent_posts.summary:
- Lightning Network supports escrow via a 2-of-3 setup; two parties must agree to proceed.
- Point Time-Locked Contracts could solve hash verification issues, but development status is unclear.
- Predicated e-cash escrows using MAST and MuSig offer simpler, secure transaction alternatives.

active_posts.title: Proposing a P2QRH BIP towards a quantum resistant soft fork
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new signature algorithm to add quantum resistance to Bitcoin.
- It marks the start of Bitcoin Improvement Proposals for the "QuBit" soft fork.
- The community is invited to review and provide feedback on the initial BIP draft.

active_posts.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
active_posts.summary:
- Stratum V2's client push increases block withholding risks, challenging mining pool profitability.
- Proposed solutions include a negotiated template approach and altering PoW to enhance security.
- Significant protocol changes are suggested to improve bitcoin mining's security and decentralization.

active_posts.title: BIP 8.5: Flag day activation based on nlocktime signaling
active_posts.summary:
- A new method for activating Bitcoin soft forks uses `nLockTime` signaling and a flag day.
- Users show support by broadcasting transactions tagged with soft fork numbers; miners signal by including them in blocks.
- The proposal includes a three-month analysis period before the flag day and offers technical implementation details on GitHub.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal analyzes Bitcoin vulnerabilities, suggesting improvements for security and performance.
- It introduces fixes for the timewarp exploit and crafted non-SegWit transaction issues.
- Community debate arises over suggestions like reducing block size, despite some consensus on enhancements.

active_posts.title: Zawy’s Alternating Timestamp Attack
active_posts.summary:
- Zawy's attack manipulates Bitcoin Testnet 4 timestamps to unfairly increase block production.
- The attack involves setting low and future timestamps to lower mining difficulty exponentially.
- Proposed mitigation includes a softfork for consistent timestamp increases to prevent such manipulations.

active_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
active_posts.summary:
- Passive and active investment strategies involve different levels of engagement and management.
- Issues like the principal/agent problem can arise from passive investment, potentially harming the economy.
- The article suggests central banks could stabilize economies using deflationary and inflationary currencies together.

today_in_history_posts.title: Reconciling the off-chain and on-chain models with eltoo
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Christian Decker discusses eltoo's potential for simplifying blockchain protocol layers.
- Eltoo's clear separation allows for complex functionalities beyond HTLCs without security complications.
- He advocates for eltoo's method for representing negotiations, enhancing on-chain and off-chain integration.

today_in_history_posts.title: Reconciling the off-chain and on-chain models with eltoo
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Richard's proof-of-concept for eltoo on signet sparks system-building discussions.
- Eltoo simplifies integration of off-chain and on-chain concepts, enhancing complex functionalities.
- It utilizes Bitcoin's transaction model, enabling use of existing tools and experimental protocols.

today_in_history_posts.title: Public archive for Delving Bitcoin
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Creating a public archive of posts is proposed to prevent content loss and enhance searchability.
- The use of scraping, API, or database dumping methods are considered for archiving.
- The recommendation suggests using API or database dumping, sharing results on a git repository.
